metadata.title: CVE-2021-47397 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:sctp: break out if skb_header_pointer returns NULL in sctp_rcv_ootbWe should always check if skb_header_pointer's return is NULL beforeusing it, otherwise it may cause null-ptr-deref, as syzbot reported:  KASAN: null-ptr-deref in range [0x0000000000000000-0x0000000000000007]  RIP: 0010:sctp_rcv_ootb net/sctp/input.c:705 [inline]  RIP: 0010:sctp_rcv+0x1d84/0x3220 net/sctp/input.c:196  Call Trace:  <IRQ>   sctp6_rcv+0x38/0x60 net/sctp/ipv6.c:1109   ip6_protocol_deliver_rcu+0x2e9/0x1ca0 net/ipv6/ip6_input.c:422   ip6_input_finish+0x62/0x170 net/ipv6/ip6_input.c:463   NF_HOOK include/linux/netfilter.h:307 [inline]   NF_HOOK include/linux/netfilter.h:301 [inline]   ip6_input+0x9c/0xd0 net/ipv6/ip6_input.c:472   dst_input include/net/dst.h:460 [inline]   ip6_rcv_finish net/ipv6/ip6_input.c:76 [inline]   NF_HOOK include/linux/netfilter.h:307 [inline]   NF_HOOK include/linux/netfilter.h:301 [inline]   ipv6_rcv+0x28c/0x3c0 net/ipv6/ip6_input.c:297
